description:
I'm installing openstack cloud controller (2 nodes configuration)
all the nova-* services seem not working (status XXX )

[root@cloud-controller01 sw]# for svc in api objectstore compute network volume scheduler cert; do sudo service openstack-nova-$svc restart ; sudo chkconfig openstack-nova-$svc on ; done
Stopping openstack-nova-api: [ OK ]
Starting openstack-nova-api: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-objectstore: [ OK ]
Starting openstack-nova-objectstore: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-compute: [FAILED]
Starting openstack-nova-compute: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-network: [FAILED]
Starting openstack-nova-network: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-volume: [FAILED]
Starting openstack-nova-volume: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-scheduler: [ OK ]
Starting openstack-nova-scheduler: [ OK ]
Stopping openstack-nova-cert: [ OK ]
Starting openstack-nova-cert: [ OK ]
[root@cloud-controller01 sw]# for svc in api objectstore compute network volume scheduler cert; do sudo service openstack-nova-$svc status ; sudo chkconfig openstack-nova-$svc on ; done
openstack-nova-api (pid 7121) is running...
openstack-nova-objectstore (pid 7143) is running...
openstack-nova-compute dead but pid file exists
openstack-nova-network dead but pid file exists
openstack-nova-volume dead but pid file exists
openstack-nova-scheduler (pid 7233) is running...
openstack-nova-cert (pid 7256) is running...
[root@cloud-controller01 sw]# ^C
[root@cloud-controller01 sw]# nova-manage service list
2012-10-05 16:23:58 DEBUG nova.utils [req-d2048e64-6cb5-434e-89b6-0c9a36e8582d None None] backend <module 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api' from '/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.pyc'> from (pid=7353) __get_backend /usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/nova/utils.py:659
2012-10-05 16:23:58 WARNING nova.utils [req-d2048e64-6cb5-434e-89b6-0c9a36e8582d None None] /usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.7.8-py2.6-linux-x86_64.egg/sqlalchemy/pool.py:683: SADeprecationWarning: The 'listeners' argument to Pool (and create_engine()) is deprecated. Use event.listen().
  Pool.__init__(self, creator, **kw)

2012-10-05 16:23:58 WARNING nova.utils [req-d2048e64-6cb5-434e-89b6-0c9a36e8582d None None] /usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.7.8-py2.6-linux-x86_64.egg/sqlalchemy/pool.py:159: SADeprecationWarning: Pool.add_listener is deprecated. Use event.listen()
  self.add_listener(l)

Binary Host Zone Status State Updated_At

nova-scheduler cloud-controller01.na.infn.it nova enabled XXX None
nova-cert cloud-controller01.na.infn.it nova enabled XXX None

 This is the nova.conf file

[DEFAULT]

# LOGS/STATE
verbose=True
logdir=/var/log/nova
state_path=/var/lib/nova
lock_path=/var/lock/nova

# AUTHENTICATION
auth_strategy=keystone

# SCHEDULER
compute_scheduler_driver=nova.scheduler.filter_scheduler.FilterScheduler

# VOLUMES
volume_driver=nova.volume.driver.ISCSIDriver
volume_group=nova-volumes
volume_name_template=volume-%08x
iscsi_helper=tgtadm

# DATABASE
sql_connection=mysql://nova:cloud99@172.16.9.131/nova

# COMPUTE
libvirt_type=qemu
#compute_driver=nova.virt.connection.get_connection
#compute_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver
compute_driver=libvirt.LibvirtDriver
instance_name_template=instance-%08x
api_paste_config=/etc/nova/api-paste.ini
allow_resize_to_same_host=True

# APIS
osapi_compute_extension=nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.standard_extensions
ec2_dmz_host=172.16.9.131
s3_host=172.16.9.131

# RABBITMQ
rabbit_host=172.16.9.131

# GLANCE
image_service=nova.image.glance.GlanceImageService
glance_api_servers=172.16.9.131:9292

# NETWORK
network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatDHCPManager
force_dhcp_release=False
dhcpbridge_flagfile=/etc/nova/nova.conf
firewall_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver
# Change my_ip to match each host
my_ip=172.16.9.131
public_interface=br100
vlan_interface=eth0
flat_network_bridge=br100
flat_interface=eth0
fixed_range=172.16.9.136/29

# NOVNC CONSOLE
novncproxy_base_url=http://172.16.9.131:6080/vnc_auto.html
# Change vncserver_proxyclient_address and vncserver_listen to match each compute host
vncserver_proxyclient_address=172.16.9.131
vncserver_listen=172.16.9.131
libvirt_inject_partition = -1

[keystone_authtoken]
auth_host = 172.16.9.131
auth_port = 35357
auth_protocol = http
auth_uri = http://172.16.9.131:5000/
admin_tenant_name = service
admin_user = nova
admin_password = nova
-----------------------------------------------------

the rpm installed with yum are
openstack-nova-network-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-scheduler-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-objectstore-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-api-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-compute-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
python-nova-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-cert-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-common-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-volume-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch
python-novaclient-2012.1-2.el6.noarch
openstack-nova-console-2012.1.1-15.el6.noarch

the python version is
python-2.6.6-29.el6_2.2.x86_64

keystone and glance work properly

selinux is disabled
title: nova-*  not work -  Scientific Linux 6.2

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~spardi

comments.content:
Thanks for giving version details.
So you're using the EPEL packages.

For notes on this see:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Getting_started_with_OpenStack_EPEL

One thing I noticed is that you've libvirt_type=qemu
That suggests you're running within a VM. So please not specifically
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Getting_started_with_OpenStack_EPEL#Installing_within_a_VM

I also notice you're using rabbitMQ here.
That's not available for EPEL by default.
Where did you get those packages?

Note if you do decide to stick with the more standard
rpc_backend = nova.rpc.impl_qpid
Please set auth=no in /etc/qpidd.conf and restart qpidd and the openstack services
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~p-draigbrady

comments.content:
Note this bug seems to be distro specific and not nova specific,
so I'm leaning towards closing this here and perhaps start
discussions on https://admin.fedoraproject.org/mailman/listinfo/cloud
with a view to logging specific bugs on bugzilla.redhat.com against
the EPEL nova component.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~p-draigbrady
